triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology being used and improved in this work through the Self-Refine approach.

triples.name: Dialog system
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates Self-Refine on dialog response generation as one of its 7 diverse benchmark tasks.

triples.name: Mathematical logic
triples.relevance: Mathematical reasoning is one of the key tasks used to evaluate the effectiveness of the Self-Refine approach.

triples.name: GPT-3
triples.relevance: GPT-3 (specifically GPT-3.5) is one of the state-of-the-art LLMs used to evaluate the Self-Refine method.

triples.name: ChatGPT
triples.relevance: ChatGPT is one of the state-of-the-art models used for evaluating Self-Refine's performance across multiple tasks.

triples.name: GPT-4
triples.relevance: GPT-4 is a state-of-the-art LLM used in the evaluation, demonstrating that even advanced models benefit from Self-Refine.

triples.name: Iterative refinement
triples.relevance: Self-Refine is fundamentally based on iterative refinement principles to improve LLM outputs through multiple rounds of generation and feedback.

triples.name: Feedback
triples.relevance: The Self-Refine approach uses feedback as a core mechanism where LLMs generate feedback on their own outputs for refinement.
